author: Zonebourse
title: En difficulté, le spécialiste du paiement Worldline évince son directeur général - Zonebourse
text:
Paris (awp/afp) - Le spécialiste des paiements électroniques Worldline, qui avait perdu 29 millions d'euros (27,2 millions de francs suisses) au premier semestre, a annoncé vendredi le départ de son directeur général depuis onze ans, Gilles Grapinet, précisant rechercher son successeur.
Marc-Henri Desportes, actuellement directeur général délégué, assurera "la période d'intérim" le temps que soit conduit le "processus de recherche d'un nouveau directeur général", précise Worldline dans un communiqué de presse.
Le groupe, constatant un "ralentissement de l'activité" au cours de l'été, a profité de cette annonce pour réviser à la baisse ses prévisions de résultats pour 2024.
Alors qu'il comptait encore en août sur une croissance organique de son chiffre d'affaires de 2 à 3% sur l'année, Worldline planche désormais sur 1%.
Un chiffre qui pourrait toutefois "augmenter si les conditions économiques s'améliorent", indique Worldline.
Pannes, dégringolade en Bourse, sortie du CAC 40, comptes dans le rouge, plan de départs... Le prestataire français a connu de nombreuses difficultés depuis plusieurs mois.
Il a publié en août un chiffre d'affaires en croissance sur le premier semestre, mais avec une perte nette de 29 millions d'euros, s'expliquant "principalement" par l'impact du "coût exceptionnel" du plan de transformation Power24 lancé en début d'année, qui s'élève à 174 millions d'euros, indiquait-il.
Ce plan intègre un lourd volet social, avec le départ de 8% des 18.000 collaborateurs dans le monde, soit environ 1.400 personnes.
"Sous le leadership de Marc-Henri Desportes, nous allons poursuivre l'exécution de Power24 et de toutes nos grandes initiatives de développement", déclare Wilfried Verstraete, président du conseil d'administration de Worldline, cité dans le communiqué.
"La journée investisseurs, initialement prévue le 26 novembre 2024, est reportée afin de permettre au nouveau directeur général de contribuer au processus de définition de la stratégie", indique par ailleurs la société.
afp/ib

author: Taylah Darnell
title: Victoria's top town has just been crowned - and it's a coastal gem
text:
24 July 2025
4 mins Read
Every year, each Aussie state reveals its most beloved destinations across three categories – the Top Tourism Town, Top Small Tourism Town and Top Tiny Tourism Town. NSW announced its winners last month. Now, it’s Victoria’s time to shine. Drum roll, please…
Say hello to Victoria’s Top Tourism Town of 2025 – Warrnambool! Open to towns with a population of 5,000 or more, this category recognises stand-out destinations that offer something truly special – and it’s not hard to see why Warrnambool took out top honours. Situated along the iconic Great Ocean Road and a three-hour drive from Melbourne, Warrnambool offers the perfect blend of regional charm and coastal bliss.
Wander along the main drag to explore cosy cafes and vintage boutiques. Or head to the coast for beautiful beaches and scenic walking trails. It’s also a great jumping-off point for the Great Victorian Bathing Trail, a 900-kilometre tourist route that takes in some of the state’s best natural geothermal baths. Start in the heart of town at Deep Blue Hot Springs, a mineral-rich sanctuary of open-air rock pools.
Add in friendly locals and a laid-back lifestyle, and Warrnambool’s win feels like a no-brainer. The regional city of Ballarat was hot on its heels, though, scoring the category’s silver award. Maybe 2026 will be your year, Ballarat!
Next up is Victoria’s Top Small Tourism Town – a category reserved for towns with a population between 1,500 and 5,000. And this year, the award goes to Mount Beauty! It’s all in the name here. This charming township, around a 4.5-hour drive from the state’s capital, sits at the base of Victoria’s highest peak, Mt Bogong.
Mount Beauty is home to some of Victoria’s most bucolic landscapes that have long attracted nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts. From horse-riding tours with Bogong Horseback Adventures to bike tracks and hiking trails, visitors are spoilt for choice. Come the cooler months, the surrounding mountains are covered in snow, and with Mount Hotham only an hour away, it’s the perfect place to book for a cosy winter weekend.
Port Fairy on the Shipwreck Coast, named after the 700+ vessels submerged in its waters, took out silver in the Top Small Tourism Town category this year. And while it may be a world away from the winner, its rich offerings made for fierce competition.
The final category shines the spotlight on Victoria’s pocket-sized towns – those with no more than 1,500 residents. Let’s hear it for the Top Tiny Tourism Town of 2025 – Trentham! Don’t let its size fool you. This historic village, under two hours north-west of Melbourne, sure packs a mighty punch. Sitting pretty atop the Great Dividing Range, Trentham has been enchanting visitors since it was established by gold prospectors in the 1850s.
Focus soon shifted to gems of a different kind – cosy country pubs, boutique stores and stylish accommodation like The Cosmopolitan Hotel – which solidified Trentham as a regional treasure. But there’s more to the suburb than its charming streetscapes. Aptly named Trentham Falls is the highest single-drop waterfall in Central Victoria, plunging more than 32 metres. Who knew one of Australia’s best waterfalls was just a five-minute drive from town?
Halls Gap claimed silver for the Top Tiny Tourism Town award. Known as the gateway to the Grampians, the village is another natural wonder. And while an abundance of waterfalls can also be found nearby, they couldn’t quite compete with Trentham’s crown jewel this year.
Bronze commendations for each category were awarded to Echuca, Portarlington and Whitfield, respectively, with all winners decided by the Victoria Tourism Industry Council.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->tourism and leisure industry

author: Decatur Daily Democrat
title: Ken’s Hardwood Barbecue, Trinity Missionary Baptist Church, and Sigma Pi Phi Fraternity Unite to Celebrate Christmas Through Acts of Kindness | News | decaturdailydemocrat.com
text: Tucson, AZ, USA - December 29, 2023 - In the spirit of Christmas, a day renowned for its traditions of giving and sharing, Ken's Hardwood Barbecue, in partnership with Trinity Missionary Baptist Church and Sigma Pi Phi Fraternity, is reaffirming its commitment to service to others. Ken Alexander, the driving force behind this heartwarming collaboration, shares, "On a day known for giving, we feel service to others is the best way for us to celebrate Christmas." As the holiday season approaches, Ken's Hardwood Barbecue, Trinity Missionary Baptist Church, and Sigma Pi Phi Fraternity joins hands for the fifth consecutive year to extend a helping hand to the hungry and unhoused in the Tucson area. On Christmas Day, they convene at Santa Rita Park to provide a hot, delicious meal, free of charge, to those in need. The Big Red Mobile Kitchen, symbolizing the unity of these organizations, will be on-site to serve and share the warmth of the season with the community. This annual event embodies the true spirit of Christmas by bringing nourishment and a sense of community to individuals who may be facing hardship during the holiday season. This commitment to selfless service has a rich history deeply rooted in the heart of Ken's family. In 2000, Ken Alexander's mother initiated a program in Jeffersonville, IN, known as the King's Table, dedicated to feeding the hungry and unhoused in the community. This remarkable program, born out of compassion and love for the community, continues to serve its residents to this day. For more information about Ken's Hardwood Barbecue or to explore its menu, visit www.kenshardwoodbbq.com or email [catering@kenshardwoodbbq.com](mailto:catering@kenshardwoodbbq.com) or call (520) 745-4746. (5250 E 22nd Street, Tucson, AZ 85711) About Ken's Hardwood Barbecue Ken's Hardwood Barbecue is a family-owned, award winning restaurant in Tucson, AZ, renowned for its unique blend of Southern comfort cuisine and expertly smoked meats. Drawing from four generations of culinary passion, the restaurant is a testament to the deep-seated traditions of Kentucky and Tennessee. With a commitment to authenticity and quality, Ken's Hardwood Barbecue continues to enthrall its patrons with mouthwatering dishes that speak of a rich heritage. author: admin
title: Francine Carton
text:
Bienvenue sur votre site d'actualité régionale
Bienvenue sur votre site d'actualité régionale
HAZEBROUCK
« Simple et généreuse était ta vie.. Que ton repos soit doux, comme ton cœur fut bon… »
Entourée de l’affection des siens
Madame Francine CARTON
s’est endormie le 27 décembre 2023 à son domicile, à l’âge de 90 ans.
Ses funérailles auront lieu le mardi 2 janvier 2024 à 15 heures en l’église Saint-Eloi à Hazebrouck, suivies de la crémation à Vendin les Béthune. Ses cendres reposeront au cimetière Saint-Eloi, sur le caveau de famille.
Réunion à l’église à 14 h 45.
L’offrande en fin de cérémonie tiendra lieu de condoléances.
De la part de
Christine VERGIN, sa fille,
Anthony VERGIN et Emilie FAUVEL,
Balian et Martel, son petit-fils et arrière-petits-fils,
Louis DELATTRE, son ami,
Maurice ✝ et Fernande ✝ CARTON-DECROCK, ses parents,
toute la famille,
toute l’équipe de l’association AZAE de Merville,
tous ceux qui l’ont entourée, connue et estimée.
Dans l’attente des funérailles, notre maman et mamie repose au salon funéraire Carnevali « Azalée » 35, rue de Merville 59190 Hazebrouck. (Ouvert de 10 heures à 19 heures)
La famille recevra les visites de 16 heures à 18 h 30.
59190 Hazebrouck - 8, rue du Pont, apt 22 résidence les Jardins de Saint-Eloi
Vous pouvez laisser vos condoléances sur www.funeraire-carnevali.fr

author: @PortalNDMais
title: FOTOS: No dia em que tornou Bolsonaro réu, Moraes fez ensaio fotográfico para revista americana
text:
No mesmo dia em que votou a favor de tornar Jair Bolsonaro réu por tentativa de golpe de Estado, o ministro Alexandre de Moraes, do STF (Supremo Tribunal Federal), participou de um ensaio fotográfico para a revista americana The New Yorker.
As fotos foram feitas para um perfil do ministro publicado nesta segunda-feira (7), na versão digital da New Yorker, uma das publicações mais influentes dos Estados Unidos. O responsável pelas imagens é o fotógrafo brasileiro Fábio Setti.
Fotógrafo diz que clima com Moraes foi “amistoso” apesar da tensão do julgamento
Em seu perfil no Instagram, Fábio Setti revelou que o ensaio aconteceu na manhã de 26 de março, data que marcou o segundo dia do julgamento no STF que analisava a denúncia da Procuradoria-Geral da República (PGR) contra o grupo central da suposta tentativa de golpe.
Setti relatou surpresa com o comportamento do ministro. “Imaginei um clima um tanto tenso, me enganei”, escreveu. Segundo ele, Moraes foi receptivo durante a sessão de fotos. A postagem, no entanto, foi alvo de críticas de apoiadores do ex-presidente e acabou removida da rede social.
A reportagem procurou o fotógrafo, mas não obteve retorno até a publicação deste texto. O espaço segue aberto para manifestação.
No perfil publicado pela New Yorker, Moraes tem sua trajetória detalhada, desde a produção de um best-seller sobre Direito Constitucional até sua chegada à Suprema Corte.
Na entrevista, o ministro defende a regulamentação das redes sociais e afirma que o ambiente digital favorece a disseminação de ódio e desinformação. Ele comparou o cenário atual com o da Segunda Guerra Mundial: “Se os nazistas tivessem o X (ex-Twitter), teriam conquistado o mundo”, declarou à revista.
